name: Upma
preparation: South Indian style roasted semolina cooked with vegetables and tempered spices.
recipe:
1. Dry roast rava in a pan till aromatic and keep aside.
2. Heat oil, temper mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, curry leaves, green chilli and ginger; sauté onions and vegetables.
3. Add water and salt, bring to a boil; slowly add roasted rava while stirring to avoid lumps.
4. Cover and cook on low flame for 3–4 minutes until rava is soft and fluffy.

name: Masala Dosa
preparation: Thin crispy dosa stuffed with mildly spiced potato masala.
recipe:
1. Boil, peel and mash potatoes. In oil, temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilli and ginger; sauté sliced onions.
2. Add turmeric, salt and mashed potatoes, sprinkle a little water and cook for 2–3 minutes.
3. Spread fermented dosa batter thinly on a hot tawa, drizzle oil and cook till the bottom turns golden and crisp.
4. Place a portion of potato masala in the centre, fold the dosa and serve with chutney and sambar.

name: Vegetable Daliya
preparation: Broken wheat cooked like a savory porridge with vegetables.
recipe:
1. Dry roast broken wheat for a few minutes and keep aside.
2. Heat oil/ghee in a cooker, splutter cumin seeds and sauté onions and vegetables.
3. Add roasted daliya, turmeric, salt and water; mix well.
4. Pressure cook for 2–3 whistles until soft and mushy; serve warm.

name: Moong Dal Chilla
preparation: High‑protein pancakes made from soaked and ground moong dal.
recipe:
1. Soak moong dal for 3–4 hours, then grind with ginger, green chilli, cumin and a little water to a smooth batter.
2. Add salt and chopped coriander leaves, mix well.
3. Heat a non‑stick tawa, pour a ladle of batter and spread into a medium‑thick circle; drizzle a little oil.
4. Cook both sides till golden and crisp; serve with mint or coriander chutney.

name: Roti with Sabzi
preparation: Chapatis served with a basic North Indian mixed vegetable curry.
recipe:
1. Knead wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt to a soft dough; rest and roll into thin rotis.
2. Cook rotis on a hot tawa, puffing them if possible; keep covered.
3. For sabzi, heat oil and sauté cumin seeds, ginger-garlic paste, chopped onion and tomato.
4. Add mixed vegetables, spices, salt and a little water; cook covered until vegetables are tender.

name: Pongal
preparation: South Indian rice and moong dal porridge tempered with ghee, pepper and cumin.
recipe:
1. Dry roast moong dal lightly, then wash rice and dal together.
2. Pressure cook with water and salt until soft and mushy.
3. Heat ghee, fry cashews till golden, then add pepper, cumin, ginger and curry leaves.
4. Pour the tempering over cooked rice-dal mixture, mix well and serve hot.

name: Paneer Paratha
preparation: Whole wheat parathas stuffed with spiced grated paneer.
recipe:
1. Crumble paneer and mix with finely chopped onion, green chilli, coriander, garam masala and salt.
2. Knead wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt into a soft dough; rest for 15 minutes.
3. Roll a dough ball, place paneer stuffing in the centre, seal and roll again to a thick paratha.
4. Roast on a hot tawa with ghee or oil till golden spots appear on both sides.

name: Rava Idli
preparation: Instant semolina idlis made with curd and mild tempering.
recipe:
1. Dry roast rava lightly and let it cool. Mix with curd, water and salt to form a thick batter.
2. Heat oil, temper mustard seeds, chana dal and curry leaves; add grated carrot and sauté briefly.
3. Add tempering to the batter, then mix in eno just before steaming.
4. Pour batter into greased idli moulds and steam for 10–12 minutes till fluffy.

name: Vegetable Daliya
preparation: Broken wheat cooked like a savory porridge with vegetables.
recipe:
1. Dry roast broken wheat for a few minutes and keep aside.
2. Heat oil/ghee in a cooker, splutter cumin seeds and sauté onions and vegetables.
3. Add roasted daliya, turmeric, salt and water; mix well.
4. Pressure cook for 2–3 whistles until soft and mushy; serve warm.

name: Besan Chilla
preparation: Savory gram flour pancakes with chopped vegetables and spices.
recipe:
1. In a bowl, whisk besan with water to form a smooth lump‑free batter.
2. Mix in finely chopped onion, tomato, capsicum, green chilli, coriander, ajwain and salt.
3. Heat a non‑stick tawa, pour a ladle of batter and spread like a pancake; drizzle a little oil.
4. Cook both sides till golden spots appear and serve hot with chutney or curd.

name: Besan Chilla
preparation: Savory gram flour pancakes with chopped vegetables and spices.
recipe:
1. In a bowl, whisk besan with water to form a smooth lump‑free batter.
2. Mix in finely chopped onion, tomato, capsicum, green chilli, coriander, ajwain and salt.
3. Heat a non‑stick tawa, pour a ladle of batter and spread like a pancake; drizzle a little oil.
4. Cook both sides till golden spots appear and serve hot with chutney or curd.

name: Stuffed Veg Sandwich
preparation: Toasted sandwich stuffed with a mildly spiced vegetable mixture.
recipe:
1. Boil and mash potato; lightly sauté mixed vegetables and onions with salt and pepper.
2. Mix mashed potato with sautéed vegetables and a spoon of green chutney.
3. Spread the stuffing between bread slices, optionally sprinkle grated cheese.
4. Toast in a sandwich maker or on a tawa with a little butter until golden and crisp.

name: Poha
preparation: Maharashtrian style tempered flattened rice with onions, peanuts and mild spices.
recipe:
1. Rinse poha in a colander, drain and keep aside to soften.
2. Heat oil, fry peanuts till crisp, then temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilli and turmeric.
3. Add chopped onions and potatoes, sauté till cooked; mix in softened poha, salt and a splash of water.
4. Cook on low for 2–3 minutes, garnish with lemon juice and coriander and serve warm.

name: Rava Idli
preparation: Instant semolina idlis made with curd and mild tempering.
recipe:
1. Dry roast rava lightly and let it cool. Mix with curd, water and salt to form a thick batter.
2. Heat oil, temper mustard seeds, chana dal and curry leaves; add grated carrot and sauté briefly.
3. Add tempering to the batter, then mix in eno just before steaming.
4. Pour batter into greased idli moulds and steam for 10–12 minutes till fluffy.

name: Uttapam
preparation: Thick dosa topped with mixed vegetables and cooked like a pancake.
recipe:
1. Heat a tawa and pour a ladle of fermented batter, spreading into a thick pancake.
2. Top with finely chopped onion, tomato, capsicum, green chilli and coriander; sprinkle a pinch of salt.
3. Drizzle a little oil around the edges, cover and cook on low flame till base is golden.
4. Flip if needed and cook the other side briefly; serve hot with chutney or sambar.

name: Paratha with Curd
preparation: Simple whole wheat parathas served with plain curd.
recipe:
1. Knead whole wheat flour with salt, ajwain and water into a soft dough; rest for 15–20 minutes.
2. Divide into balls, roll into discs and cook on a hot tawa with a little oil or ghee on both sides.
3. Whisk curd until smooth.
4. Serve hot parathas with a bowl of plain curd.

4. Mix well and serve immediately as a tangy, filling snack.

name: Rava Idli
preparation: Instant semolina idlis made with curd and mild tempering.
recipe:
1. Dry roast rava lightly and let it cool. Mix with curd, water and salt to form a thick batter.
2. Heat oil, temper mustard seeds, chana dal and curry leaves; add grated carrot and sauté briefly.
3. Add tempering to the batter, then mix in eno just before steaming.
4. Pour batter into greased idli moulds and steam for 10–12 minutes till fluffy.

name: Masala Dosa
preparation: Thin crispy dosa stuffed with mildly spiced potato masala.
recipe:
1. Boil, peel and mash potatoes. In oil, temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilli and ginger; sauté sliced onions.
2. Add turmeric, salt and mashed potatoes, sprinkle a little water and cook for 2–3 minutes.
3. Spread fermented dosa batter thinly on a hot tawa, drizzle oil and cook till the bottom turns golden and crisp.
4. Place a portion of potato masala in the centre, fold the dosa and serve with chutney and sambar.

name: Poha
preparation: Maharashtrian style tempered flattened rice with onions, peanuts and mild spices.
recipe:
1. Rinse poha in a colander, drain and keep aside to soften.
2. Heat oil, fry peanuts till crisp, then temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilli and turmeric.
3. Add chopped onions and potatoes, sauté till cooked; mix in softened poha, salt and a splash of water.
4. Cook on low for 2–3 minutes, garnish with lemon juice and coriander and serve warm.

name: Besan Chilla
preparation: Savory gram flour pancakes with chopped vegetables and spices.
recipe:
1. In a bowl, whisk besan with water to form a smooth lump‑free batter.
2. Mix in finely chopped onion, tomato, capsicum, green chilli, coriander, ajwain and salt.
3. Heat a non‑stick tawa, pour a ladle of batter and spread like a pancake; drizzle a little oil.
4. Cook both sides till golden spots appear and serve hot with chutney or curd.

name: Pongal
preparation: South Indian rice and moong dal porridge tempered with ghee, pepper and cumin.
recipe:
1. Dry roast moong dal lightly, then wash rice and dal together.
2. Pressure cook with water and salt until soft and mushy.
3. Heat ghee, fry cashews till golden, then add pepper, cumin, ginger and curry leaves.
4. Pour the tempering over cooked rice-dal mixture, mix well and serve hot.

name: Paneer Paratha
preparation: Whole wheat parathas stuffed with spiced grated paneer.
recipe:
1. Crumble paneer and mix with finely chopped onion, green chilli, coriander, garam masala and salt.
2. Knead wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt into a soft dough; rest for 15 minutes.
3. Roll a dough ball, place paneer stuffing in the centre, seal and roll again to a thick paratha.
4. Roast on a hot tawa with ghee or oil till golden spots appear on both sides.

name: Paratha with Curd
preparation: Simple whole wheat parathas served with plain curd.
recipe:
1. Knead whole wheat flour with salt, ajwain and water into a soft dough; rest for 15–20 minutes.
2. Divide into balls, roll into discs and cook on a hot tawa with a little oil or ghee on both sides.
3. Whisk curd until smooth.
4. Serve hot parathas with a bowl of plain curd.

name: Idli with Sambar
preparation: Fermented rice and lentil batter steamed into idlis and served with a vegetable lentil sambar.
recipe:
1. Soak rice, urad dal and fenugreek seeds for 4–6 hours, grind to a smooth batter, add salt and ferment overnight.
2. Pour fermented batter into greased idli plates and steam for 10–12 minutes until fluffy.
3. Pressure cook toor dal, then boil with chopped vegetables, tamarind, sambar powder and salt until cooked.
4. Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves in a little oil, pour over the sambar and serve hot with idlis.

name: Veg Sandwich
preparation: Simple cold sandwich with assorted raw vegetables and green chutney.
recipe:
1. Spread butter and green chutney on bread slices.
2. Layer sliced cucumber, tomato, onion and grated carrot, sprinkle a little salt and pepper.
3. Cover with another slice, press gently and trim edges if desired.
4. Serve as is or lightly toast on a tawa or sandwich maker.

name: Oats Upma
preparation: Savory oats upma cooked with vegetables and South Indian tempering.
recipe:
1. Dry roast oats for 2–3 minutes and keep aside.
2. Temper mustard seeds, dals, curry leaves and green chilli in oil; sauté onions and vegetables.
3. Add water and salt, bring to a boil and then stir in roasted oats.
4. Cover and cook on low flame till oats soften and water is absorbed.

name: Plain Dosa with Chutney
preparation: Crispy fermented rice and lentil crepes served with coconut chutney.
recipe:
1. Soak rice, urad dal and fenugreek seeds, grind to a smooth batter, add salt and ferment overnight.
2. For chutney, grind coconut, roasted chana dal, green chilli, ginger, salt and water to a smooth paste.
3. Heat a tawa, pour a ladle of batter, spread into a thin circle and drizzle a little oil around the edges.
4. Cook till crisp and golden, then serve hot dosas with tempered coconut chutney.

name: Upma
preparation: South Indian style roasted semolina cooked with vegetables and tempered spices.
recipe:
1. Dry roast rava in a pan till aromatic and keep aside.
2. Heat oil, temper mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, curry leaves, green chilli and ginger; sauté onions and vegetables.
3. Add water and salt, bring to a boil; slowly add roasted rava while stirring to avoid lumps.
4. Cover and cook on low flame for 3–4 minutes until rava is soft and fluffy.

name: Sprouts Salad Bowl
preparation: Chatpata sprouts chaat/salad tossed with vegetables and tangy chutneys.
recipe:
1. Steam or boil mixed sprouts till just tender, then cool.

3. Add green and tamarind chutneys, chaat masala, lemon juice and salt.
4. Mix well and serve immediately as a tangy, filling snack.

name: Oats Porridge
preparation: Creamy sweet oats porridge cooked with milk/water and topped with fruits and nuts.
recipe:
1. Combine oats and milk/water in a saucepan and bring to a gentle boil.
2. Simmer for 4–5 minutes stirring occasionally until oats are cooked and creamy.
3. Sweeten with honey or jaggery if desired.
4. Serve in a bowl topped with chopped fruits and nuts.

3. Add chopped onions and potatoes, sauté till cooked; mix in softened poha, salt and a splash of water.
4. Cook on low for 2–3 minutes, garnish with lemon juice and coriander and serve warm.

recipe:

name: Moong Dal Chilla
preparation: High‑protein pancakes made from soaked and ground moong dal.
recipe:
1. Soak moong dal for 3–4 hours, then grind with ginger, green chilli, cumin and a little water to a smooth batter.
2. Add salt and chopped coriander leaves, mix well.
3. Heat a non‑stick tawa, pour a ladle of batter and spread into a medium‑thick circle; drizzle a little oil.
4. Cook both sides till golden and crisp; serve with mint or coriander chutney.

name: Pongal
preparation: South Indian rice and moong dal porridge tempered with ghee, pepper and cumin.

name: Rava Idli

recipe:

2. Heat oil, temper mustard seeds, chana dal and curry leaves; add grated carrot and sauté briefly.
3. Add tempering to the batter, then mix in eno just before steaming.
4. Pour batter into greased idli moulds and steam for 10–12 minutes till fluffy.

name: Paneer Biryani

ingredients.name: Whole spices (bay leaf, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon)

preparation: Layered one‑pot Paneer Biryani cooked with aromatic spices, basmati rice and paneer cubes.
recipe:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 20–30 minutes.
2. Marinate protein with curd, ginger‑garlic paste, biryani masala and salt for at least 20 minutes.
3. In a pot, heat oil/ghee and sauté whole spices, sliced onions and tomatoes until lightly browned.
4. Add marinated protein and cook partially, then layer soaked rice on top, add water and salt.
5. Cover and cook on low flame until rice is fluffy and protein is cooked; garnish with mint and coriander.

name: Veg Pulao
preparation: One‑pot mildly spiced rice pulao with mixed vegetables.
recipe:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 20 minutes.
2. Heat oil/ghee, sauté whole spices, sliced onions, green chilli and ginger‑garlic paste.
3. Add mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
4. Add soaked rice, water and salt; cook covered till rice is fluffy and vegetables are tender.

name: Curd Rice
preparation: South Indian style curd rice tempered with mustard, curry leaves and grated vegetables.
recipe:
1. Mash cooked rice lightly and let it cool slightly.
2. Whisk curd (and milk if using) with salt, then mix into the rice.
3. Heat oil and temper mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves and chopped green chilli.
4. Pour tempering over the curd rice, mix in grated carrot/cucumber and serve at room temperature.

name: Chicken Curry with Roti
preparation: Whole wheat rotis served with mixed vegetable curry.
recipe:
1. Knead whole wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt into a soft dough; rest 15–20 minutes.
2. Roll into thin rotis/chapatis/phulkas and cook on a hot tawa, puffing if desired.
3. For the side dish, heat oil, sauté cumin seeds, ginger‑garlic paste, chopped onions and tomatoes.
4. Add mixed vegetables, spices and salt; cook until done and serve with hot rotis.

name: Rajma Chawal
preparation: Rajma (kidney bean) curry served with steamed rice as a complete meal.
recipe:
1. Soak rajma (kidney beans) if needed, then pressure cook till soft (for eggs/fish, cook separately).
2. Heat oil, sputter cumin seeds and sauté onion till golden; add ginger‑garlic paste and tomatoes.
3. Add spice mix, turmeric, coriander powder and salt; then add cooked beans/eggs/fish and some water.
4. Simmer until the gravy thickens and flavours blend; serve hot with cooked rice.

name: Veg Sambar with Brown Rice
preparation: Sambar served with steamed rice as a complete meal.
recipe:
1. Soak toor dal if needed, then pressure cook till soft (for eggs/fish, cook separately).
2. Heat oil, sputter cumin seeds and sauté onion till golden; add ginger‑garlic paste and tomatoes.
3. Add spice mix, turmeric, coriander powder and salt; then add cooked beans/eggs/fish and some water.
4. Simmer until the gravy thickens and flavours blend; serve hot with cooked rice.

name: Roti with Mixed Veg
preparation: Whole wheat rotis served with mixed vegetable curry.
recipe:
1. Knead whole wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt into a soft dough; rest 15–20 minutes.
2. Roll into thin rotis/chapatis/phulkas and cook on a hot tawa, puffing if desired.
3. For the side dish, heat oil, sauté cumin seeds, ginger‑garlic paste, chopped onions and tomatoes.
4. Add mixed vegetables, spices and salt; cook until done and serve with hot rotis.

name: Khichdi
preparation: Comforting one‑pot Khichdi cooked soft with raw rice and lentils.
recipe:
1. Wash grain and dal together and soak for 15–20 minutes.
2. Heat ghee/oil in a pressure cooker, splutter cumin seeds and sauté ginger and vegetables.
3. Add drained grain‑dal mix, turmeric, salt and water; mix well.
4. Pressure cook for 2–3 whistles until soft and mushy; adjust consistency with hot water if needed.

name: Lemon Rice
preparation: Tempered rice flavoured with lemon juice, turmeric and crunchy peanuts.
recipe:
1. Spread cooked rice on a plate to cool and keep grains separate.
2. Heat oil, fry peanuts till crisp, then temper mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, curry leaves and green chilli.
3. Add turmeric and salt, mix and switch off the flame; cool slightly and add lemon juice.
4. Toss the cooled rice into the tempering until evenly coated and serve.

name: Chole Chawal
preparation: Chole (chickpea) curry served with steamed rice as a complete meal.
recipe:
1. Soak kabuli chana (chickpeas) if needed, then pressure cook till soft (for eggs/fish, cook separately).
2. Heat oil, sputter cumin seeds and sauté onion till golden; add ginger‑garlic paste and tomatoes.
3. Add spice mix, turmeric, coriander powder and salt; then add cooked beans/eggs/fish and some water.
4. Simmer until the gravy thickens and flavours blend; serve hot with cooked rice.

name: Roti with Dal
preparation: Whole wheat rotis served with dal tadka.
recipe:
1. Knead whole wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt into a soft dough; rest 15–20 minutes.
2. Roll into thin rotis/chapatis/phulkas and cook on a hot tawa, puffing if desired.
3. For the side dish, heat oil, sauté cumin seeds, ginger‑garlic paste, chopped onions and tomatoes.
4. Add toor / moong dal, spices and salt; cook until done and serve with hot rotis.

name: Lemon Rice
preparation: Tempered rice flavoured with lemon juice, turmeric and crunchy peanuts.
recipe:
1. Spread cooked rice on a plate to cool and keep grains separate.
2. Heat oil, fry peanuts till crisp, then temper mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, curry leaves and green chilli.
3. Add turmeric and salt, mix and switch off the flame; cool slightly and add lemon juice.
4. Toss the cooled rice into the tempering until evenly coated and serve.

recipe:
1. Knead whole wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt into a soft dough; rest 15–20 minutes.
2. Roll into thin rotis/chapatis/phulkas and cook on a hot tawa, puffing if desired.
3. For the side dish, heat oil, sauté cumin seeds, ginger‑garlic paste, chopped onions and tomatoes.
4. Add mixed vegetables, spices and salt; cook until done and serve with hot rotis.

name: Dal Tadka with Rice
preparation: Dal tadka served with steamed rice as a complete meal.
recipe:
1. Soak toor / moong dal if needed, then pressure cook till soft (for eggs/fish, cook separately).
2. Heat oil, sputter cumin seeds and sauté onion till golden; add ginger‑garlic paste and tomatoes.
3. Add spice mix, turmeric, coriander powder and salt; then add cooked beans/eggs/fish and some water.
4. Simmer until the gravy thickens and flavours blend; serve hot with cooked rice.

name: Chicken Biryani

ingredients.name: Whole spices (bay leaf, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon)

preparation: Layered one‑pot Chicken Biryani cooked with aromatic spices, basmati rice and chicken pieces.
recipe:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 20–30 minutes.
2. Marinate protein with curd, ginger‑garlic paste, biryani masala and salt for at least 20 minutes.
3. In a pot, heat oil/ghee and sauté whole spices, sliced onions and tomatoes until lightly browned.
4. Add marinated protein and cook partially, then layer soaked rice on top, add water and salt.
5. Cover and cook on low flame until rice is fluffy and protein is cooked; garnish with mint and coriander.

name: Fish Curry with Rice
preparation: Fish curry served with steamed rice as a complete meal.
recipe:
1. Soak fish pieces if needed, then pressure cook till soft (for eggs/fish, cook separately).
2. Heat oil, sputter cumin seeds and sauté onion till golden; add ginger‑garlic paste and tomatoes.
3. Add spice mix, turmeric, coriander powder and salt; then add cooked beans/eggs/fish and some water.
4. Simmer until the gravy thickens and flavours blend; serve hot with cooked rice.

name: Veg Thali
preparation: Typical Indian style preparation for Veg Thali using a basic curry base.
recipe:
1. Prepare the main ingredient (boil, chop or marinate) as suitable for the dish.
2. Heat oil, sauté ginger‑garlic paste, chopped onions and tomatoes.
3. Add spices, salt and the main ingredient; cook till flavours combine and ingredient is done.
4. Adjust consistency with water if needed and serve hot.

name: Lemon Rice
preparation: Tempered rice flavoured with lemon juice, turmeric and crunchy peanuts.
recipe:
1. Spread cooked rice on a plate to cool and keep grains separate.
2. Heat oil, fry peanuts till crisp, then temper mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, curry leaves and green chilli.
3. Add turmeric and salt, mix and switch off the flame; cool slightly and add lemon juice.
4. Toss the cooled rice into the tempering until evenly coated and serve.

name: Khichdi
preparation: Comforting one‑pot Khichdi cooked soft with raw rice and lentils.
recipe:
1. Wash grain and dal together and soak for 15–20 minutes.
2. Heat ghee/oil in a pressure cooker, splutter cumin seeds and sauté ginger and vegetables.
3. Add drained grain‑dal mix, turmeric, salt and water; mix well.
4. Pressure cook for 2–3 whistles until soft and mushy; adjust consistency with hot water if needed.

name: Curd Rice
preparation: South Indian style curd rice tempered with mustard, curry leaves and grated vegetables.
recipe:

name: Veg Fried Rice
preparation: Stir‑fried rice tossed with vegetables and light seasoning.
recipe:
1. Heat oil in a wok, sauté chopped garlic and white part of spring onions.

3. Add cooled cooked rice, soy sauce, pepper and salt; toss well on high heat.
4. Finish with the green part of spring onions and serve hot.

name: Ragi Dosa
preparation: Thin crepes made from ragi flour batter, cooked crisp on a tawa.
recipe:
1. Prepare a pourable batter with the flour/batter, water and salt.
2. Heat a tawa, pour a ladle of batter and spread quickly into a thin circle.
3. Drizzle little oil or ghee around the edges and cook till crisp and browned.
4. Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

name: Mixed Veg Curry with Roti
preparation: Whole wheat rotis served with mixed vegetable curry.
recipe:
1. Knead whole wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt into a soft dough; rest 15–20 minutes.
2. Roll into thin rotis/chapatis/phulkas and cook on a hot tawa, puffing if desired.
3. For the side dish, heat oil, sauté cumin seeds, ginger‑garlic paste, chopped onions and tomatoes.
4. Add mixed vegetables, spices and salt; cook until done and serve with hot rotis.

4. Add paneer cubes, spices and salt; cook until done and serve with hot rotis.

name: Curd Rice
preparation: South Indian style curd rice tempered with mustard, curry leaves and grated vegetables.
recipe:
1. Mash cooked rice lightly and let it cool slightly.
2. Whisk curd (and milk if using) with salt, then mix into the rice.
3. Heat oil and temper mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves and chopped green chilli.
4. Pour tempering over the curd rice, mix in grated carrot/cucumber and serve at room temperature.

name: Millet Khichdi
preparation: Comforting one‑pot Millet Khichdi cooked soft with foxtail millet and lentils.
recipe:
1. Wash grain and dal together and soak for 15–20 minutes.

4. Pressure cook for 2–3 whistles until soft and mushy; adjust consistency with hot water if needed.

name: Ragi Dosa

name: Sprouts Chaat
preparation: Chatpata sprouts chaat/salad tossed with vegetables and tangy chutneys.
recipe:
1. Steam or boil mixed sprouts till just tender, then cool.
2. Combine sprouts with chopped onions, tomatoes, cucumber and coriander.
3. Add green and tamarind chutneys, chaat masala, lemon juice and salt.
4. Mix well and serve immediately as a tangy, filling snack.

name: Fruit Bowl
preparation: Assorted seasonal cut fruits served plain or with a light drizzle of honey/lemon.
recipe:
1. Wash and peel fruits as needed; cut into bite‑sized pieces.
2. Combine all fruits in a bowl.
3. Drizzle a little lemon juice or honey if desired and toss gently.
4. Serve immediately for best freshness.

name: Upma (small portion)
preparation: Smaller portion of vegetable upma made with roasted semolina.
recipe:
1. Lightly roast rava and keep aside.
2. Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil, then sauté onions and mixed vegetables.
3. Add water and salt, bring to boil and slowly whisk in the roasted rava.
4. Cover and cook till rava absorbs water and becomes soft and fluffy.

name: Dry Fruit Mix
preparation: Assorted unsalted mixed nuts and dried fruits.
recipe:
1. Measure all nuts and dried fruits.
2. Lightly dry roast nuts if desired for extra crunch.
3. Cool and mix together in a bowl.
4. Store in an airtight container and use as a small snack portion.

name: Cucumber Carrot Sticks
preparation: Raw cucumber and carrot cut into sticks and served with simple seasoning or dip.
recipe:
1. Peel and cut cucumber and carrot into even sticks.
2. Sprinkle lightly with salt, pepper and lemon juice.
3. Serve as a crunchy low‑calorie snack, optionally with hung curd dip.

name: Sprouts Chaat
preparation: Chatpata sprouts chaat/salad tossed with vegetables and tangy chutneys.

2. Combine sprouts with chopped onions, tomatoes, cucumber and coriander.
3. Add green and tamarind chutneys, chaat masala, lemon juice and salt.

preparation: Sweet lassi made lighter with less sugar or natural sweetener.
recipe:

3. Serve immediately in a glass, optionally garnished with a few crushed nuts.

name: Oats Tikki
preparation: Shallow‑fried cutlets made with oats, potatoes and vegetables.
recipe:
1. Mash boiled potatoes and mix with oats, grated carrot, chopped green chilli, coriander and spices.
2. Form small flat tikkis from the mixture.
3. Heat a tawa, drizzle little oil and shallow fry tikkis till golden on both sides.
4. Serve with green chutney or tomato ketchup.

name: Veg Cutlet Baked
preparation: Baked vegetable cutlets made with potatoes, mixed vegetables and crumbs.
recipe:
1. Boil and mash potatoes; par‑boil mixed vegetables and drain well.
2. Mix potatoes, vegetables, crumbs/poha, spices and salt into a firm mixture.
3. Shape into cutlets, place on a greased tray and brush lightly with oil.
4. Bake or air‑fry until golden brown, turning once halfway through.

name: Poha Cutlet
preparation: Baked vegetable cutlets made with potatoes, mixed vegetables and crumbs.

name: Idli with Chutney
preparation: Typical Indian style preparation for Idli with Chutney using a basic curry base.
recipe:
1. Prepare the main ingredient (boil, chop or marinate) as suitable for the dish.
2. Heat oil, sauté ginger‑garlic paste, chopped onions and tomatoes.

name: Buttermilk
preparation: Thin spiced buttermilk made from diluted curd.
recipe:
1. Churn curd with water until smooth and frothy.

2. Add boiled chickpeas and salt; sauté for 2–3 minutes.
3. Mix in grated coconut, stir and switch off the flame.
4. Serve warm as a protein‑rich snack or side.

name: Fruit Bowl
preparation: Assorted seasonal cut fruits served plain or with a light drizzle of honey/lemon.
recipe:
1. Wash and peel fruits as needed; cut into bite‑sized pieces.
2. Combine all fruits in a bowl.
3. Drizzle a little lemon juice or honey if desired and toss gently.
4. Serve immediately for best freshness.

name: Poha Cutlet
preparation: Baked vegetable cutlets made with potatoes, mixed vegetables and crumbs.
recipe:
1. Boil and mash potatoes; par‑boil mixed vegetables and drain well.
2. Mix potatoes, vegetables, crumbs/poha, spices and salt into a firm mixture.
3. Shape into cutlets, place on a greased tray and brush lightly with oil.
4. Bake or air‑fry until golden brown, turning once halfway through.

name: Dry Fruit Mix
preparation: Assorted unsalted mixed nuts and dried fruits.
recipe:
1. Measure all nuts and dried fruits.
2. Lightly dry roast nuts if desired for extra crunch.
3. Cool and mix together in a bowl.
4. Store in an airtight container and use as a small snack portion.

name: Sprouted Moong Salad
preparation: High‑protein salad made with steamed sprouted moong and fresh vegetables.
recipe:
1. Lightly steam sprouted moong for 3–4 minutes or use raw if preferred.
2. Mix with chopped onion, tomato, cucumber and coriander leaves.
3. Season with salt, chaat masala and lemon juice; toss well.
4. Serve immediately as a healthy snack or side.

name: Boiled Egg
preparation: Simple hard‑boiled eggs served sliced with salt and pepper.
recipe:
1. Place eggs in a saucepan, cover with water and bring to a gentle boil.
2. Simmer for 8–10 minutes for hard‑boiled eggs.
3. Cool in cold water, peel and slice.
4. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper before serving.

name: Cucumber Carrot Sticks
preparation: Raw cucumber and carrot cut into sticks and served with simple seasoning or dip.
recipe:
1. Peel and cut cucumber and carrot into even sticks.
2. Sprinkle lightly with salt, pepper and lemon juice.
3. Serve as a crunchy low‑calorie snack, optionally with hung curd dip.

name: Bhel Puri
preparation: Mumbai style puffed‑rice chaat tossed with vegetables, chutneys and sev.
recipe:
1. In a large bowl, combine puffed rice, sev, chopped boiled potatoes, onions and tomatoes.
2. Add tamarind and green chutneys, lemon juice, chaat masala and mix quickly.
3. Garnish with coriander leaves and extra sev.
4. Serve immediately before the puffed rice turns soggy.

name: Sprouts Chaat
preparation: Chatpata sprouts chaat/salad tossed with vegetables and tangy chutneys.
recipe:
1. Steam or boil mixed sprouts till just tender, then cool.
2. Combine sprouts with chopped onions, tomatoes, cucumber and coriander.
3. Add green and tamarind chutneys, chaat masala, lemon juice and salt.
4. Mix well and serve immediately as a tangy, filling snack.

name: Upma (small portion)
preparation: Smaller portion of vegetable upma made with roasted semolina.
recipe:
1. Lightly roast rava and keep aside.
2. Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil, then sauté onions and mixed vegetables.
3. Add water and salt, bring to boil and slowly whisk in the roasted rava.
4. Cover and cook till rava absorbs water and becomes soft and fluffy.

name: Chicken Kebab (grilled)
preparation: Yogurt‑marinated chicken cubes grilled on skewers or tawa.
recipe:
1. Marinate chicken cubes with curd, ginger‑garlic paste, spices, lemon juice and salt for at least 30 minutes.
2. Thread marinated chicken onto skewers.
3. Grill in an oven/air‑fryer or on a greased grill pan, brushing with a little oil.
4. Cook till chicken is tender and edges are slightly charred; serve hot with lemon wedges.
